The areas of America where divorce rates are highest are also frequently the areas where many conservative Christians live. Kentucky, Mississippi and Arkansas voted overwhelmingly for constitutional amendments to ban gay marriage. But they had three of the highest divorce rates in 2003, based on figures from the Census Bureau and the National Center for Health Statistics.
